alert.note: Alert for Gila; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 27 at 1:34AM MST until July 27 at 2:15AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM MST EARLY THIS MORNING FOR CIBECUE CREEK IN GILA AND NAVAJO COUNTIES... At 127 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated that heavy rain has ended across the warning area, west and southwest of Cibecue. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain fell earlier this evening. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fort Apache Reservation. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Cibecue Creek and Spring Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
